@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The image class displays an image file This class supports image clipping, which means that multiple images can be combined into one large image and only the relevant part is shown. Example Here is a little example of how to use the widget. 

   var image = new qx.ui.basic.Image("icon/32/actions/format-justify-left.png");
   this.getRoot().add(image);

This example create a widget to display the image icon/32/actions/format-justify-left.png. External Documentation Documentation of this widget in the qooxdoo manual. NOTE: Instances of this class must be disposed of after use

@param.name: @param
@param.body: source {String?null} The URL of the image to display.
@param.description: The URL of the image to display.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The URL of the image. Setting it will possibly abort loading of current image.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the image should be scaled to the given dimensions This is disabled by default because it prevents the usage of image clipping when enabled.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether to preserve the image ratio (ie prevent distortion), and which dimension to prioritise

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether to allow scaling the image up

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired if the image source can not be loaded. This event can only be fired for the first loading of an unmanaged resource (external image).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired if the image has been loaded. This is even true for managed resources (images known by generator).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when the pending request has been aborted.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remembers the mode to keep track which contentElement is currently in use.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the current mode if set. Otherwise checks the current source and the current scaling to determine the current mode.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates a contentElement suitable for the current mode

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns a contentElement suitable for the current mode

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Applies the source to the clipped image instance or preload an image to detect sizes and apply it afterwards.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Helper function, which fires loaded event asynchronously. It emulates native loaded event of an image object. This helper will be called, if you try to load a managed image or an previously loaded unmanaged image.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the content element.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if the current content element is capable to display the image with the current settings (scaling, alpha PNG)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks the current child and replaces it if necessary

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Use the ResourceManager to set a managed image

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Use the infos of the ImageLoader to set an unmanaged image

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Use the ImageLoader to load an unmanaged image

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Reset source displayed by the DOM element.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Combines the decorator's image styles with our own image to make sure gradient and backgroundImage decorators work on Images.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Event handler fired after the preloader has finished loading the icon

@param.name: @param
@param.body: source {String} Image source which was loaded

@param.name: @param
@param.body: imageInfo {Map} Dimensions of the loaded image

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Updates the content hint when the image size has been changed

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Recalculates the size of the image, according to scaling parameters

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.
